articles.headline: A YouTuber Shoots to Literary Fame in France, Ruffling Feathers
articles.snippet: The social media star known as Léna Situations, 23, had a pretty eventful 2020. She racked up millions of followers, became a best-selling author — and attracted criticism from the Paris book world.
articles.abstract: The social media star known as Léna Situations, 23, had a pretty eventful 2020. She racked up millions of followers, became a best-selling author — and attracted criticism from the Paris book world.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Léna Situations shot to fame in France by sharing fashion advice and tips for living a positive life with millions of her followers on social media.

articles.headline: How Andy Jassy, Amazon’s Next C.E.O., Was a ‘Brain Double’ for Jeff Bezos
articles.snippet: Mr. Jassy, who will become Amazon’s chief this summer, has spent more than two decades absorbing lessons from Mr. Bezos.
articles.abstract: Mr. Jassy, who will become Amazon’s chief this summer, has spent more than two decades absorbing lessons from Mr. Bezos.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — In 2002, Andy Jassy, a young executive at Amazon, began closely shadowing Jeff Bezos, the founder of the online bookstore.
articles.byline: By Karen Weise and Daisuke Wakabayashi

articles.headline: McKinsey Settles for Nearly $600 Million Over Role in Opioid Crisis
articles.snippet: The consulting firm has reached agreements with 49 states because of its sales advice to drugmakers, including Purdue Pharma, the manufacturer of OxyContin.
articles.abstract: The consulting firm has reached agreements with 49 states because of its sales advice to drugmakers, including Purdue Pharma, the manufacturer of OxyContin.
articles.lead_paragraph: McKinsey & Company, the consultant to blue-chip corporations and governments around the world, has agreed to pay nearly $600 million to settle investigations into its role in helping “turbocharge” opioid sales, a rare instance of it being held publicly accountable for its work with clients.
articles.byline: By Michael Forsythe and Walt Bogdanich

articles.headline: Top House Republican Condemns Marjorie Taylor Greene’s Comments, but Stands by Her
articles.snippet: In a statement, Representative Kevin McCarthy of California said he “unequivocally” condemned the Georgia freshman’s violent and conspiracy-laden remarks, but declined to revoke her committee posts.
articles.abstract: In a statement, Representative Kevin McCarthy of California said he “unequivocally” condemned the Georgia freshman’s violent and conspiracy-laden remarks, but declined to revoke her committee posts.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The top House Republican refused on Wednesday to punish Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene for spreading false and bigoted conspiracy theories and endorsing political violence against Democrats, condemning the Georgia freshman’s previous comments but declining to take away her posts on influential congressional committees.
articles.byline: By Catie Edmondson, Jonathan Martin and Nicholas Fandos

articles.headline: Inside the Shadowy Militias Luring Unsuspecting Afghans to Fight, or Die
articles.snippet: Afghanistan’s poor are being deceived into defending outposts from the Taliban, sometimes under the guise of construction work — a scheme partially bankrolled by the government.
articles.abstract: Afghanistan’s poor are being deceived into defending outposts from the Taliban, sometimes under the guise of construction work — a scheme partially bankrolled by the government.
articles.lead_paragraph: MAZAR-I-SHARIF, Afghanistan — A network of shadowy power brokers and warlords, bankrolled by the Afghan government and the national police force, is luring disadvantaged people into joining militias, sometimes under false pretenses, out of a growing desperation to hold territory around highways in the country’s north, according to former militia members and local officials.
articles.byline: By Fahim Abed and Thomas Gibbons-Neff

articles.headline: Toll Worker Job Losses Highlight Long-Term Fallout of Pandemic
articles.snippet: The Pennsylvania Turnpike laid off workers to switch to labor-saving technology, in what might be a broader trend.
articles.abstract: The Pennsylvania Turnpike laid off workers to switch to labor-saving technology, in what might be a broader trend.
articles.lead_paragraph: John Mahalis of Philadelphia was two and a half months from qualifying for his full pension when he learned that he would be permanently laid off from his job as a toll collector on the Pennsylvania Turnpike. The news was a gut punch; Mr. Mahalis said it would leave him less able to financially weather retirement.

articles.headline: Jeff Zucker, CNN’s Longtime Leader, Says He Expects to Leave at Year’s End
articles.snippet: The executive, who shaped the look and feel of CNN since coming aboard in 2013, helped build the Trump myth and then tried to knock it down.
articles.abstract: The executive, who shaped the look and feel of CNN since coming aboard in 2013, helped build the Trump myth and then tried to knock it down.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jeffrey A. Zucker, the relentless, ratings-obsessed executive who transformed American television news and played a central role in the political rise of Donald J. Trump, said Thursday that he expected to step down from his job running CNN at the end of the year.
articles.byline: By Ben Smith and Katie Robertson
